question: Which is the largest ancient castle in the world?
explanation: Prague Castle of the Czech Republic is the largest ancient castle in the world, according to the Guinness Book of Records. It was built in the 9th century. It is the official office of the President of the Czech Republic. Earlier it was the seat of power of Kings of Bohemia and Holy Roman Emperors. It is among the most visited tourist attraction inÂ  Prague. The St. Vitrus Cathedral at Prague Castle is home of the Czech crown jewels and the burial place of the Czech kings.
